carrying.name: (a map of the South Caelia Wailing Mountains)
(a map of the South Caelia Borderhold and roads)
(a map of Anlun Vale and Beach)

mobs.long_desc: A thin-faced man awaits your business.
mobs.desc: This thin, ageless man looks back at you with a steady gaze.  He seems to know no fear, and has little expression, but a slight spark of amusement or mirth does seem to brighten his eye.  His movements appear smooth and regulated, and he checks his guests in and out efficiently.

mobs.long_desc: A dark-skinned elf peers at you from behind the counter.
mobs.desc: The normally ostentatious garb of a banker is forgone here, perhaps a good idea in the presence of so many soldiers.  But a closer look shows that Slevvirik's clothing is anything but cheap, made of soft grey silk and expertly tailored. How he maintains such a wardrobe in these parts is a mystery.  But drow are ever difficult to predict.

mobs.long_desc: Dugrik stands here, ready make unauthorized sales to line his own pocket.
mobs.desc: Is it an orc, or did one of the giant cooking cauldrons move?  Dugrik is huge and covered with soot, so the mistake is understandable.  He glumly feeds hordes of soldiers all day long, so the sight of a paying customer -- even though selling the food is strictly prohibited -- is the highlight of his day.

mobs.long_desc: Woddly stands here ready to make you a special deal.
mobs.desc: What's a gnome doing in the middle of an orc army?  Making money, of course! Woddly has a keen nose for business, and it had better be good for something, taking up so much space on his face as it does.  Woddly is short and bright-eyed and loves selling cheap goods.

mobs.long_desc: Dorndle sits here scribing something with his ink-stained fingers.
mobs.desc: There is something unsettling about such a serious gnome.  His nose hooks down cruelly, and his black robes bypass comical to give him a truly dark aura. His attitude, however, is all business.

mobs.long_desc: Arandidor stands here making sure his creatures don't eat each other.
mobs.desc: Arandidor is a dark-skinned human with a curly beard.  He seems jovial at times and dour at others, which is no wonder considering the motly collection of animals he manages.  His white robes are clean and he looks ready to sell you a loyal companion.

mobs.long_desc: A jovial man with a turban and a moustache observes you idly.
mobs.desc: It is odd for anyone to be cheerful in these parts, much less a human.  But Myrzistan appears to be quite happy.  He has medium-tan skin and a dark brown moustache, and wears white robes and a turban.  He smells slightly of farm animals, no doubt because that is what he's about to sell you.

mobs.long_desc: Skosh leans forward against the bar, staring at you.
mobs.desc: He's quite large and fat, and obviously no warrior, but he knows a good war when he sees one.  Skosh is a born entrepreneur who can set up shop anywhere with anything, and doesn't need anyone's help.  He runs this tavern with a chaotic hand, a hand that pulls in profit under the worst conditions.

mobs.long_desc: An ageless elf with dark skin and white hair looks at you coldly.
mobs.desc: Drow and orcs don't often mix, but few things please dark elves more than extracting a profit from their more vulgar cousins.  Jhanna looks to have done well in this chaotic place, for her shop is undisturbed and her bearing regal. Her white hair and unwrinkled skin make estimating her age impossible.

mobs.long_desc: A somewhat small and shifty-eyed orc prepares to sell you a weapon.
mobs.desc: As orcs go, this one is a bit small, no taller than five feet.  He seems to be looking to one side, then the other.  Ralg has a downtrodden appearance and a hunch in his spine.  He also has quite a variety of weapons to sell.

mobs.long_desc: Unndush stands here glaring at you, arms folded.
mobs.desc: This fairly large orc has quite a bulk and shows the scars of many battles. Whether they were battles with enemy soldiers or angry customers is not clear. At any rate, Unndush has plenty of shields and is ready to sell them.

mobs.long_desc: An orc looks up from his sewing needle to see what you want.
mobs.desc: Argesh is limber and strong.  His characteristically dark orc skin is stained here and there, especially on his hands.  His nimble fingers pierce orc hide with a large needle as he fabricates another item for sale.

mobs.long_desc: Grulo sullenly sits in his shop waiting for you to buy something.
mobs.desc: Grulo's right arm hangs useless, and a small scar is clearly visible on his shoulder.  His left arm is quite formidable, however.  He uses it to sling great weapons about like toothpics as he shows off his wares to prospective buyers.  The gutteral orc-speak that issues from his mouth might have an undertone of regret.

mobs.long_desc: Krigg proudly shows off his polished armor.
mobs.desc: Krigg is rightly proud of his gleaming bronze goods.  Cheaper than steel and stronger than iron, they are a good compromise that allows armies to be outfitted with much less fuel and work than steel.  Still, for adventurers, it is only a step on the way to better things.  Krigg keeps the shop sparkling and the goods flowing.

mobs.long_desc: A huge and powerful orcess peers down at you.
mobs.desc: Ghiala is rather large for an orc.  Polished steel gleams all over: her armor, bracers, and even her necklace look like curved mirrors.  She moves like a dangerous warrior, and sells like a shrewd merchant.

mobs.long_desc: Gagar, the master sorcerer, stands in the shadows.
mobs.desc: There must be an orc somewhere beneath those bushy eyebrows.  Gagar is small but has an aura of power that even orcs must feel, giving him a wide berth as they do.  His flashy robes make him a comical sight.

mobs.keywords: tinilas rogue elf half half-elf master guildmaster
mobs.long_desc: Tinilas stands nearby, looking at you casually.
mobs.desc: Tinilas seems somewhat out of place at first, his half-elven ears poking out of his ruffled dirty-blonde hair.  There is a ruthlessness in his eyes, however. Even the most boistrous of orcs keep their distance or speak to him with some deference.  An air of danger clings to him.

mobs.long_desc: A bald-headed orc in simple robes waits by the altar.
mobs.desc: It is rare indeed for an orc to aspire to acts of healing, but Rorgdush is one who has.  His simple robe is unstained by the usual blood of sacrifices that clerical orcs ritually perform.  Nevertheless he shows little love for the living, reserving his awe for the gods above, and healing only when it is in his interest.

mobs.long_desc: Grort stops sparring for a moment to scowl at you.
mobs.desc: This orc has a temper to match any other.  Even your minor intrustion seems to have started his face reddening with anger!  Nobody messes with Grort unless they're good and ready to learn combat -- the hard way if necessary!

mobs.long_desc: A dark gray crab the size of a dinner plate sits here sullenly.
mobs.desc: This usually motionless crab sports a pair of vicious-looking pincers.  It is as large as a plate and a dark gray color, mottled as if composed of ashes. Its eyes move little and it is impossible to tell whether it is looking at anything, or whether it is even alive, until its characteristically quick jerky movements show that its pincers still present danger.

mobs.long_desc: A sharp-beaked parrot peers up at you inquisitively.
mobs.desc: This stout little bird prefers to stand rather than fly, and hops about.  It has greenish plumage that appears to be brown when turned to the light.  Its curved beak looks fairly sharp and cruel, as do its black claws.  All in all, the kea looks interesting but somewhat dangerous.

mobs.long_desc: A medium-sized lynx with tawny fur stands calmly nearby.
mobs.desc: The graceful walk of this solitary predator is a beautiful thing to behold. Its tan coat and black-tipped ears would hide it well in a desert environment. The caracal is much smaller than a lion, but quite a bit larger than an ordinary house cat.

mobs.long_desc: A tired-looking old nag stands here quietly.
mobs.desc: A horse such as this would normally be put to pasture or slaughtered, but Myrzistan knows no such kindness.  He can make money from this beast, so he will.  The old mare's spine and ribs are clearly visible below her mangy skin. She won't go far.

mobs.long_desc: A gaunt, mean-looking camel glares about.
mobs.desc: This is an old beast.  It must have come far and worked hard, but its work is not yet done.  Its mangy hide is stretched thin over bony ribs, and its once-tawny fur is now patchy.  It looks meaner than ever.

mobs.long_desc: A skeletal old ox teeters on its thin legs.
mobs.desc: The indentation of the harness is still visible on the neck of this working steer, but it would be foolhardy to hook a cart to this staggering beast.  It has barely the strength to carry a single passenger now.  It totters on stick-like legs and its white coat is stretched over its skeleton like the skin of a kayak.

mobs.long_desc: A strong plough horse stands here munching on straw.
mobs.desc: This beast is in fairly good shape, and must have been taken recently from a farm, for a farm beast it is.  It is unused to the bridle, and its neck is worn from years pulling a plough.  It has a dark brown coat.

mobs.long_desc: A long, low-slung reptile with fierce teeth looks off into space.
mobs.desc: This clearly predatory creature has been tamed or domesticated somehow...  One would hope!  Its long sharp teeth and pointed snout clearly mark it as a predator.  Anklecrushers are known for hiding in the dry sands of central Umulg and biting the feet and ankles of passers-by...  Then following them for days as their strength gives out, making them easy prey.  This specimen looks to be a mount of some sort, however.

mobs.long_desc: A small black and gray snake sits here coiled and motionless.
mobs.desc: This small reptile seems very bold for such a diminutive creature.  It has gray scales with odd black spots, and the widened jaw of a viper.  Perhaps it is more dangerous than it appears.

mobs.long_desc: A glum-looking orc patroller slogs through the streets.
mobs.desc: A step above your average soldier, this warrior keeps the peace when tempestuous soldiers get out of line.  However, he is nearly as likely to start trouble as to resolve it.  His superior fighting skills usually mean that he'll get his way, right or wrong.

mobs.long_desc: A glowering warlock keeps a careful watch over the area.
mobs.desc: This orcish spellcaster is dressed entirely in brown, understated leather. The usual flamboyance of orc magi is suppressed, for he is in the service of the army to provide security... generally from his own forces, who bore easily. He smells of smoke and singed flesh.

mobs.long_desc: The captain of the guard surveys the area for trouble.
mobs.desc: This must be the largest orc ever, approaching seven feet in height and covered with muscle.  He looks like he never gets out of the way for anyone.  Trouble seems to melt away at his approach, at least the trouble he isn't starting.

mobs.long_desc: A giant ogrish enforcer strides heavily through the crowd.
mobs.desc: When the ordinary orc guards need muscle, they call on these behemoths.  What they lack in smarts they make up for in raw bulk.  The sight of orc soldiers flying through the air is a sure sign that the enforcers are having fun.

mobs.long_desc: A member of the elite guard strides through the throng.
mobs.desc: The best of the best orc warriors become members of the elite guard.  This one has the typical haughty look of self-assuredness that they wear.  Unlike the lesser guards, their troublemaking is rarely overt.  That doesn't mean they don't appreciate a little chaos, however.  The bunched muscles and tense look of this fellow give him an air of danger that few soldiers care to test.

mobs.long_desc: An orcish gate guard gazes dully at the passing traffic.
mobs.desc: All guards must be able to fight well, but this one has a slovenly appearance. The requirement for gate guard duty is the ability to go long stretches without becoming bored, and in orcs, that means either exceptional intelligence or amazing stupidity.  Guess which one this is.

mobs.long_desc: An orcish gate guard gazes dully at the passing traffic.
mobs.desc: All guards must be able to fight well, but this one has a slovenly appearance. The requirement for gate guard duty is the ability to go long stretches without becoming bored, and in orcs, that means either exceptional intelligence or amazing stupidity.  Guess which one this is.

mobs.long_desc: An orcish gate guard gazes dully at the passing traffic.
mobs.desc: All guards must be able to fight well, but this one has a slovenly appearance. The requirement for gate guard duty is the ability to go long stretches without becoming bored, and in orcs, that means either exceptional intelligence or amazing stupidity.  Guess which one this is.

mobs.long_desc: A massive ogre stands guard.
mobs.desc: Of all the ogres in the area, this one surely looks the most dangerous.  It stands a full half head over the rest, and is bulky to match.  Immense muscles bulge all over its shoulders, chest, and arms.  It is also scarred, but it appears never to have suffered serious injury.  Its most casual movement embodies the deadly grace of a skilled combat veteran.

mobs.long_desc: A quiet hooded orc guards the entrance.
mobs.desc: This orc looks very ordinary, almost strangely so.  Unlike the orc soldiers who tromp about with patched armor and fetishes, this one is dressed entirely in plain clothing with no decorations whatsoever.  Stranger still, no weapon is in sight.

mobs.long_desc: A black-clad guard watches over the tent.
mobs.desc: This guard looks dangerous and calm.  He returns your stare with a gaze of quiet confidence.  This is strange behavior for an orc, for whom peace is practically unknown.  Still, his demeanor is backed up by a warrior's grace and an obviously well-muscled body.

mobs.long_desc: A single ogre stands quietly next to the entrance.
mobs.desc: Clad in a simple robe, this ogre stands alone to guard the way into the tent. Though he appears normal, all who enter the tent seem to be giving him a wide berth...  But they are unable to avoid his gaze.  This is odd behavior for an ogre.

mobs.long_desc: The postmaster waits to see what you want.
mobs.desc: This man looks a little nervous to be living among so many orcs.  He must be glad to be at least a bit separated from them, with his business on the opposite side of the river from the army's main encampment.  He looks middle-aged and patient.

mobs.long_desc: Kekund stands guard over his precious alcohol.
mobs.desc: He's a mighty fat orc with a lot of leather on him.  Kekund looks like the kind of guy who just hangs out around wars for the fun of it...  Or perhaps the profit.  He smells of beer and is pretty jovial for an orc.

mobs.long_desc: A drunken soldier staggers along.
mobs.desc: Boredom has reduced this soldier to drinking - or is that his normal state? This red-faced orc has had plenty to drink and can barely keep his feet.  The smell of belches hangs about him.  His armor is stained and broken.

mobs.keywords: guard armored crimson crimson-armored orc guardisn
mobs.long_desc: A crimson-armored guard stands watch.
mobs.desc: This poised and ready guard stands calmly by the entrance to the red tent, clad in gleaming armor of crimson that makes him visible from afar.  He looks calmly at passersby and fidgets little.  He carries himself with confidence.

mobs.keywords: sorcerer blue robed blue-robed mage orc
mobs.long_desc: A blue-robed sorcerer stands by the entrance the the tent.
mobs.desc: This cool-looking orc appears to be controlling access to the deep blue tent. He's a little fidgety, but still projects an aura of confidence.  No one seems to be giving him any backtalk, either.  He is a bit thin, but otherwise fairly normal-looking for an orc.

mobs.long_desc: A dark knight in ashen armor stands guard.
mobs.desc: Little can be seen of this guardian but the dark-gray color of his ashen armor, and the calm poise with which he carries himself.  He says nothing while allowing some and preventing others from entering the room to the north.  Evil surrounds him, but in this place he does not stand out because of it.

mobs.long_desc: A fiery-eyed priest glowers at all who come near.
mobs.desc: No light of heaven burns in the eyes of this devout cleric, nor could it be expected to in this unholy place.  Pure evil streams from him, his unrelenting glare withering all upon whom it falls.  What greater power could this black-souled orc be guarding?

mobs.long_desc: A bedraggled mercenary slumps against a wall.
mobs.desc: On closer inspection, this hired soldier reveals himself to be a human!  He must be in dire straits indeed to have signed on with an orc army.  He looks inscrutable and defensive, and not a little dirty.  He appears to be waiting for time to pass.

mobs.long_desc: A small, ragged refugee looks blankly at passers-by.
mobs.desc: This little halfling looks a bit shocked and insensitive.  Perhaps recent horrors have driven it to hopelessness.  Its pale blue eyes stare ahead, avoiding eye contact and searching everywhere.  He looks pale and emaciated, and his clothing is ragged.  He has no shoes, and his feet have open sores on them.

mobs.long_desc: A tiny little refugee crouches near the wall looking for scraps.
mobs.desc: On closer inspection, a halfling woman is hidden under the dust and rags worn by this sad little creature.  Her right arm hangs useless as she clings to a wall for support.  She glares at the ground beneath her with some anger, eyes flitting to and fro, perhaps searching for morsels of food.

mobs.long_desc: A lanky slave stands vigilantly nearby.
mobs.desc: One of the few humans in the area, this slave looks deferential yet not frightened.  Perhaps he has learned that showing fear is not a good strategy among the orcs.  He is thin but not starving.  He has the look of one with a little responsibility, but not much hope.

mobs.long_desc: A small child in rags hobbles by.
mobs.desc: Apparently another refugee, this little halfling must be very bold or stupid to remain in the area.  His left leg is missing below the knee.  He shows great agility in maneuvering about with his crutch, however.  He is thin but does not appear to be sick or starving.

mobs.long_desc: A seagull picks at the garbage.
mobs.desc: The rats of the sea are never far from the trash heaps of civilization, if they are within a reasonable distance of the ocean.  This gray and white bird is somewhat large and sports an elongated yellow beak with a red spot.

mobs.long_desc: A wily jackal stands nearby sniffing the air.
mobs.desc: Looking like a small dog, though cleverer, this scavenger is taking advantage of the sloppy habits that armies always have.  It looks well-fed and alert, and keeps effectively to the shadows as it picks through the trash.

mobs.long_desc: An undead knight watches over the stairs.
mobs.desc: Long since deceased, this unholy warrior still labors.  He stands beside the stairs with the patience of a stone, as if unwilling to let any pass for eternity.  Though his life has ceased, his powers are great, perhaps enhanced by the foul magicks that raised him from his timely grave.

mobs.keywords: pyromancer master-pyromancer orc mage sorcerer guildmaster
mobs.long_desc: The master pyromancer stands ready to test your resolve.
mobs.desc: Clad in blood-red leather, this bushy-eyebrowed orc is a fearful sight.  His red eyes seem to burn holes right through you.  Though he is a practitioner of fire, no scars or blemishes mark his tanned skin.

mobs.keywords: cryomancer orc mage sorcerer master guildmaster
mobs.long_desc: The Master of Ice looks coolly in your direction.
mobs.desc: Deep blue robes make this olivine orc difficult to spot in the low light of the tent.  His gaze still pierces those who would disturb him, however.  He seems ready to share the wisdom of cold and death to those who would approach him with the proper respect.

mobs.long_desc: A dread knight dressed entirely in black notes your arrival.
mobs.desc: Though not currently dressed for combat, the aura of evil surrounding this warrior makes his profession unmistakable.  He is an anti-paladin, a warrior of the dark.  From his demeanor, it would seem that he is here to train others in his profession, and so undermine the forces of good that stand arrayed against this army.

mobs.keywords: diabolist diabolical cleric priest orc guildmaster
mobs.long_desc: A fallen cleric awaits the arrival of the unpious, that he may train them.
mobs.desc: Simple black robes are all that this foul orc needs, for few creatures could approach to do him physical harm.  His communion with the fell spirits of the underworld ensure that.  To look upon his eyes is to invite madness.  But those who ally with him will be assured of the best training, for he seeks to spread his unholy ways across all the world.

mobs.keywords: queen undead orc orcess schkerra guildmaster
mobs.long_desc: Schkerra, queen of the undead, shrieks in laughter at your arrival.
mobs.desc: Some touch of madness must lie upon this orcess, for all that she sees and hears fills her with outbursts of mirth.  And all around her are the signs of death and decay.  She is dressed in the skins of light humanoids and her numerous braids are filled with knucklebones.  She stares grinning, perhaps to impart the power of life over death to you, her gentle visitor.

mobs.long_desc: A wary adventurer with warty greenish skin watches the street.
mobs.desc: This watchful troll is over six feet tall and has greenish-brown skin.  He has a rounded head with glaring black eyes and lower teeth that jut out of his mouth.  His dusty leather clothing looks well-used.

mobs.long_desc: The former mayor stands here looking despondent.
mobs.desc: This man, the former mayor of Tyllwedd, stands here beaten.  He looks a bit scuffed and bruised.  Oddly, he still wears a brown suit of some kind that must have been quite the fashion when he held office.  Now it is dirty and torn.  A subservient look enters his eyes whenever an orc passes near.

mobs.long_desc: A large loud orc in general's insignia feeds his face.
mobs.desc: Angrugg has a contented look as long as he isn't bothered.  He's a very large, muscular, and scarred orc.  His uniform is remarkably clean and mended, by orc standards.  His yellow eyes have begun to darken with age, and some gray hairs hide in his moustache, but he appears to have many years of pillaging ahead of him.

mobs.long_desc: A colonel of the orc army lounges against the wall.
mobs.desc: Khapser is rather tall and lanky for an orc.  His long moustaches hang down well past his chin, and his nose points downward like a divining rod.  His thinning hair hangs down his back in braids.  Khapser always seems to be scowling at something.

mobs.long_desc: A muscular orc wearing the mark of a lieutanant is standing here.
mobs.desc: The black bushy eyebrows of this large orc make him look perpetually angry. Add to that his considerable bulk and his habit of getting in people's faces, and you have somebody who commands respect but little friendship.  Udz doesn't smell particularly good, either.

mobs.long_desc: A tough-looking yet simpering orc with lieutenant's insignia waits nearby.
mobs.desc: Lieutenant Higg has a look of servitude in one eye and one of oppression in the other.  His moustache points to each side directly in the horizontal.  He appears to be a powerful warrior, but one with a developing pot belly.  His uniform may be the sharpest of any orc in the area.

mobs.long_desc: A small halfling wanders about grabbing trash.
mobs.desc: This morose fellow wanders about, picking up trash.  He is gaunt and has a particular stare that chills you.  His clothing is dirty and his feet look a bit diseased, but he continues on his endless mission.  Bruises stand out on his arms.

mobs.long_desc: A skinny janitor scans the area for trash.
mobs.desc: This poorly-fed human stands here on the lookout for stray garbage.  His eyes shift about, watching not just for trash but for bored orcs who would like nothing better than to smack someone around who dares not fight back.  He looks rather agile, and though he has some scars, there is little evidence of recent bruising.

mobs.long_desc: A runty troll slave stands near a kettle, stirring.
mobs.desc: The legendary troll stamina has been put to work in this slave. He wears a dirty white smock that seems to identify him as part of the mess crew. He has a glum look and a glare in his eye, and no doubt would not stand for enslavement if not for his size.

mobs.long_desc: A plump, bored orc sits nearby with a snack.
mobs.desc: Esh looks bored, perhaps a little superior, dressed in his tanned brown leathers with matching cap.  His perfect moustash bobs up and down as he munches on jerky.  There is no particular evidence of illusory talent showing, but then again, what need is there for it?

mobs.long_desc: A sullen guard leans against the wall near the staircase.
mobs.desc: This guard, though dressed in fairly nice leathers, looks unhappy.  He also looks quite dangerous.  He appears to be guarding the staircase.

mobs.long_desc: This Mercenary is Jhanna's hired muscle.
mobs.desc: This Mercenary is Jhanna's hired muscle.  He's ready to handle anything that might go sideways here.

mobs.long_desc: Khargol the vicious guildmaster rules the Berserker Guild from here.
mobs.desc: Dredged up from some forsaken swamp and unleashed on the unsuspecting inhabitants of South Caelia, Khargol is more savage and vicious than any other troll on the continent.  His warty green skin is covered in scars that even his trollish regenerative abilities cannot fully heal, reminders of brutal battles other creatures could never have survived.  Murdering and frenzing his way up the ranks, he has established himself guildmaster of the ravaging Berserker Guild of Ogakh.

mobs.long_desc: A wild troll berserker guard stands before the tent.
mobs.desc: This troll is a giant beast of a creature, primed to slay at a moment's notice. Years of experience and countless ravaging battles have earned him a place of honor guarding the Berserker Guild.  It is his duty to keep out any who might accidentally enter the guildhall - for their own safety.

objects.ground: A massive watering trough sits next to the stable, supported by posts.

extras.text: The trough is made of thick blank planks pegged together in a long "V" shape. It is rather huge, and would have to be to supply the stream of orc soldiers who fill buckets from it frequently.  Though orcs are not known for their hygiene, the water appears to be clean and clear.  Naturally it is covered with graffiti.
Most of it is an incomprehensible orc scrawl, but some deep black lettering near the base catches your eye: Cronax 2006

objects.ground: A small round hard lump of bread lies here forgotten.

extras.text: This is a dark, hard piece of bread. It looks like it was prepared by uninterested hands. Still, it contains much-needed energy.

objects.ground: A handful of dried fish gives off an interesting aroma.

extras.text: It takes a handful of these little fish to make a meal, especially when dried. These brown morsels don't look or smell particularly good, but at least they aren't spoiled.

objects.ground: Someone lost their fried potato cake here.

extras.text: Potatoes are notoriously easy to grow and useful for eating, but that doesn't make them any less bland.  Thankfully, it appears that a non-orc cook had a hand in the preparation of this cake, for it has been heavily flavored with strong but not offensive spices.

objects.ground: A glistening slab of brown meat lies here attracting flies.

extras.text: There's nothing simpler to prepare than raw liver: even a knife is optional. This is a recipe that even orcs couldn't screw up. Unfortunately, it takes a particular kind of palate to appreciate it... one that could pose a danger to the unwary.

objects.ground: A tightly-bound packet of dried spiced meat sits on the ground.

extras.text: The contents of this packet resemble a sort of mushy meaty grit with some green and brown spices mixed in.  It smells a bit like jerky, so this must be the good stuff.  It will keep forever and satisfies like a much larger meal.

objects.ground: A long black shiny feather flutters in the breeze.
A small bag is crumpled on the floor.

extras.text: This is a small simple bag made of cloth.

objects.ground: A brass lantern sits here on the ground.

extras.text: This is a rather small brass lantern.  It is made entirely of thin sheets of brass, except for the handle which is wood.  Perforations around the combustion chamber let out the light, but cut back on the wind.

objects.ground: A large torch lies here.
A gray scroll is lying here.
A delicate silvery ring was lost here.

extras.text: Light and delicate, this silvery ring embodies fine workmanship.  The inner surface is smooth and polished.  The outside is slightly curved, and features a pair of intertwined lines that run the length of the ring's surface.

objects.ground: A silver and gold wristband encrusted with deep red rubies sits on the ground.

extras.text: Smoothly polished silver and gold links intermingle in a vaguely serpentine pattern.  Small red rubies are set in a meandering row all down the middle, with three rather large rubies that glow deeply in any ambient light.  The effect is mesmerizing.

objects.ground: A small cracked axe with a stained handle lies here.

extras.text: This cruel implement looks to be forged from iron, though crudely.  It has a short shaft to which is attached the iron head.  A long "chin" extends downward a ways to give it a longer cutting edge, and it is rather heavy.  Given the chips and scratches, it has been used as much as a club as a slashing weapon.

objects.ground: A spiky morningstar lies in the mud.

extras.text: This weapon comprises a wooden handle to which is attached a short chain with a metal ball at the end.  The ball has had holes drilled into it and various spikes jammed in.  It is rusted and stained with many colors of ichorous liquid.

objects.ground: A hefty chipped battleaxe waits for carnage.

extras.text: This is a rather large weapon that must be held in both hands to be effective. A massive curved blade is mounted at the end of a pole, and a spike is attached at the end of the pole for thrusting.  It has seen many battles and repairs, and the blade is notched in several places.

objects.ground: A banana-shaped waterskin made of pale hide was dropped here.

extras.text: Orcs, notoriously disdainful of horses, have no qualms about making tools from their body parts.  This is one example.  The workmanship is rough and the pieces oddly cut.  However, it will carry a quantity of water.

objects.ground: A crude pottery mug has been set here.

extras.text: This is a crudely made mug from a nearby potter's wheel.  A shapeless handle sticks out from the side.

objects.ground: A crude pottery mug has been set here.

extras.text: This is a crudely made mug from a nearby potter's wheel.  A shapeless handle sticks out from the side.

objects.ground: A bottle of dark brown glass lies on its side.

extras.text: This bottle is full of stretched bubbles and looks none too strong.  For the moment, however, it is not leaking, though it smells of powerful liquor.

objects.ground: A brown-stained cup has been set here.

extras.text: It's just a white ceramic cup with a small handle.  The inside is stained brown, and the bottom has scuff marks.

objects.ground: A little cup sits here.

extras.text: This small cup looks well-used but sturdy.  It is made of some kind of polished white porcelain, and is ever so slightly stained inside.

objects.ground: A metal mug with a handle sits on the ground.

extras.text: This is a rather large mug made of some dull gray metal.  A handle is riveted to one side.  The design of a mermaid is etched into one side, as if by a jeweler, but without a great deal of talent.

objects.ground: A shot glass has been set on the ground.

extras.text: This is a small glass for holding a small but powerful drink.

objects.ground: A large wooden cask sits on its end.

extras.text: Iron bands hold together the slats of this large cask.  It smells of beer and has evidently been sitting in the dirt for some time.  Lichens are growing on one end and mold on the other.

objects.ground: An orcish war standard stands in the mud at a slight angle.

extras.text: This tall heavy standard dominates the area.  It is made from wrought iron. Three twists run its length, and at the top is the ragged banner of the orcs. Two small halfling skulls have been cruelly hung on either side of the banner. Where its length is within the reach of the orcish soldiers, it has been rubbed smooth by constant touching.

objects.ground: A softly glowing ring of white metal sits quietly in the sand.
Some weird wiggly wires are attached to a little board.

extras.text: It's got a thick loop of wire that is bended into a spiral at one end.  This loop is temporarily bent down and fixed in place by a delicate trigger.  It could sure hurt your finger if you're not careful!

objects.ground: A potion lies here waiting to be quaffed!
A dark glass decanter sits here looking stately.

extras.text: It looks like dark, shiny glass, but seems a little heavier.  The decanter has a slightly metallic sheen, revealing its lead crystal material.  It is shaped like half an hourglass; the top quickly narrows from a wide, rounded base and is stopped by a small wooden cork.

objects.ground: A dark green bottle labeled 'absinthites oinos' rests here.

extras.text: The bottle is blown from dark green glass; a stained white label wraps around the bottle reading, 'absinthites oinos.'
