triggers.name: Nasty sulfur fumes
triggers.commands: set victim %random.char% if %victim% == 0 || %victim.vnum% != -1 halt end set damage 2 switch %random.10% case 1 set damage 1 case 2 wsend %victim% You just inhaled a lungful of sulphurous fumes!  It burns! wechoaround %victim% %victim.name% inhales a lungful of fumes and chokes and gags! wdamage %victim% %damage% break case 3 case 4 wsend %victim% The stinking yellow smoke wafts under your nose, making you sneeze. wechoaround %victim% %victim.name% breathes in a bit of yellow smoke, and sneezes. break case 5 case 6 wsend %victim% Your eyes water from the rotten-smelling smoke. wechoaround %victim% %victim.name% blinks as the nasty smoke gets in %victim.p% eyes. break default wecho Nasty fumes waft up from the wreckage.  They smell of rotten egs. done

triggers.name: Sulfur smell from the east
triggers.commands: switch %random.8% case 1 wecho A breath of sulphur drifts in from the east. break case 2 wecho Stinking fumes waft in from the ruined building east of here. break case 3 wecho Smoke drifts in from the east, bringing with it the stink of rotten eggs. break case 4 wecho A sulphurous odor fills your nose. break case 5 wecho Yellowish vapors creep in from the wreckage to the east. break case 6 wecho A repulsive smell from the east invades your nose. break case 7 wecho Swirling currents of air carry the odor of sulphur. break default wecho An offensive smell appears to be emanating from the building to the east. done

triggers.name: prevent recite
triggers.commands: switch %cmd% case r case re return 0 halt done return 1 msend %actor% You cannot recite scrolls in a shop or guild!

triggers.name: prevent use
triggers.commands: switch %cmd% case u return 0 halt done return 1 msend %actor% You cannot use wands or staves in a shop or guild!

triggers.name: receive enemy communication
triggers.commands: switch %object.vnum% case 30212 return 1 wait 4 mjunk scroll say Why thank you... good spy.  I'll have my warlocks extract this message, say and find out what those self-righteous paladins are up to. wait 2 s say Here is something for your trouble. eval gemvnum 55581 + %random.8% mload obj %gemvnum% eval gemvnum 55581 + %random.8% mload obj %gemvnum% give all.gem %actor.name% break case 30208 return 1 wait 3 mjunk parchment growl wait 2 s say What are you doing with this!  You spy!  Paladin!  GUARDS! wait 1 s open door wait 4 eval damage %actor.level% * 2 + 5 mdamage %actor% %damage% crush if %damdone% == 0 mechoaround %actor% %self.name% tries to kick %actor.name%, but is having trouble with %self.p% foot! msend %actor% %self.name% tries to kick you, but is having trouble with %self.p% foot! else mechoaround %actor% %self.name% kicks %actor.name% solidly in the head! (&1%damdone%&0) msend %actor% %self.name% kicks you solidly in the head! (&1%damdone%&0) mechoaround %actor% %actor.name% is sent reeling through the doorway! msend %actor% You topple through the door into the next room! wait 3 mteleport %actor% 30038 mforce %actor% look end break default return 0 mechoaround %actor% %actor.name% tries to give %object.shortdesc% to %self.name%. msend %actor% You try to give %object.shortdesc% to %self.name%, but %self.n% refuses. wait 1 s say I don't need your rubbish!  Show some respect, dog! done

triggers.name: give things to the wrong officer
triggers.commands: switch %object.vnum% case 30212 case 30208 return 0 mechoaround %actor% %actor.name% tries to give %object.shortdesc% to %self.name%. msend %actor% You try to give %object.shortdesc% to %self.name%, but %self.n% refuses. wait 1 s say Eh?  Don't bother me with this stuff. say Give it to the general, he does all the planning around here. break default return 0 mechoaround %actor% %actor.name% tries to give %object.shortdesc% to %self.name%. msend %actor% You try to give %object.shortdesc% to %self.name%, but %self.n% refuses. wait 1 s say What?  Don't bother me with such trifles! done

triggers.name: General Angrugg babbles
triggers.commands: mutter wait 4 say What ARE those filthy paladins up to? wait 2 s stomp wait 1 s say I would pay handsomely for information as to their activities... wait 1 s emote looks at you meaningfully.

triggers.name: General Angrugg greets orcs
triggers.commands: if %actor.race% /= orc wait 2 s mechoaround %actor% %self.alias% looks at %actor.alias%. msend %actor% %self.alias% looks at you. wait 1 s say Hrm, perhaps you can help me. say I need to know what those treacherous paladins are up to. wait 3 s say Bring me some of their messages, if you find any, and I will reward you. endif

triggers.name: Enter Illusionist Guild Ogakh
triggers.commands: return 1 wdoor 30020 west room 30120 wforce %actor% west wdoor 30020 west purge

triggers.name: load random gems
triggers.commands: * number of gems to load -- statring at 3, but that might be too many set loop 3 * gem vnums go from  to 55566-55751 * p1 vnums from 55566-55593 * p2 vnums from 55594-55670 * P3 cnums from 55671-55747 (there are gems up to 55751, but not used. * random # -- 1-10 to create probabilites of good gem * 0 = NO GEM * 1 = NO GEM * 2-6 = P1 Gem * 7-9 = P2 Gem * 10  = P3 Gem * -- lets see if we should run process to get gems * -- we do that by looking for object 18701 -- if we are wearing it * -- then we don't need to load gems again * all the important stuff incased in this loop if !%self.wearing[18701]% mload obj 18701 mat 1100 wear lock set itt 1 while %itt% <= %loop% set p %random.10% if %p% == 10 *say p3! %p% set base 55671 set extra %random.76% endif *p2 gem if (%p% <=9) && (%p%>=7) *say p2 %p%555 set base 55594 set extra %random.76% endif *p1 gem if (%p% <=6) && (%p%>=2) *say p1 %p% set base 55566 set extra %random.27% endif *no gem if (%p% < 2) *say no gem - %p% set base 0 set extra 0 endif if %base% > 55560 eval gem %base% + %extra% mload obj %gem% sell gem Jhanna endif eval itt %itt% + 1 done endif

triggers.name: A test trigger
triggers.commands: if %actor.has_completed[relocate_spell_quest]% say I see that %actor.name% has completed the relocate spell quest! else say So, %actor.name% has not completed the relocate spell quest. endif

rooms.name: Perched Sanctum
rooms.description: Stretched cowhides cover the walls, mostly blocking out the light that slips in between the wooden slats.  Though magic fills the air, there are few of the usual accoutrements: scrolls, powder, and potions.  Instead, a row of identical books is carefully contained between bone bookends on the single desk.  A staircase leads downward in the center of the room.

rooms.name: Town Center
rooms.description: The tramping of innumerable boots have churned this small intersection into a muddy, smelly morass.  This is the center of what was once the tiny village of Tyllwedd.  Now, its ruins lie smoking all around.  Some buildings have survived, however.  To the southeast is a stout stone building that stands firm under chips and scars, while partly reconstructed structures lie to the west. Muddy roads lead in all directions.

rooms.name: Tiny Street
rooms.description: Tiny Street runs alongside the wall of a building to the west.  The street is strewn with ashes and broken stones.  An empty lot lies east, and the river beyond that.  To the north is a wide open square heaped with rubbish.  The town center is south.

extras.text: The rubbish gives off a thin column of smoke. It is too far away to see much from here.

rooms.name: Market Square
rooms.description: This is the southwestern corner of Market Square.  A partly-burned heap lies in the center of the square, full of scorched poles and fabrics, and smelling of decaying garbage.  Smoke rises all around, especially from a burnt-out hulk to the west.  A muddy, ground-up street leads south.

extras.text: The long, slender poles and gaily colored fabrics could only have come from the outdoor stalls that sellers could rent on a daily basis to hawk their wares. Now they are rent and broken, and piled in a smouldering heap.

rooms.name: Market Square
rooms.description: This is the northwest corner of Market Square.  The stench of rotting fish rises from a sticky morass of mud and scaly carcasses that grind underfoot. Shards of pottery are strewn about, some rather large.  Gutted buildings surround the square, but the one to the north shows fewer signs of damage, and even some repairs.

extras.text: The pots appear to have been simple and large, with wide mouths.  Their presence reinforces the rumor that the Tyllweddians liked their fish extremely fresh, so that some sellers would keep them alive in large clay urns in Market Square.  Alas, it has all been spoiled.

rooms.name: Market Square
rooms.description: This is the northeast corner of Market Square, and the air is filled with a choking sulphurous smoke.  It appears to be billowing out of a broken shop to the east.  The building to the north is completely burned away and looks to have been transformed into a thoroughfare for orcs inhabiting the northern encampment.

rooms.name: Market Square
rooms.description: This forlorn corner of Market Square is filled with trash.  The river flows by on the east, and a vacant lot is south of here.  A light but annoying breeze brings wisps of smoke and sulphur constantly.  Smoking, ruined buildings surround the square everwhere but here.

rooms.name: Vacant Lot
rooms.description: This is a somewhat steeply sloping patch of land in the middle of a ruined village.  A river rushes by on the east, its cold waters flowing south toward a bridge.  The ground is strewn with broken bricks, bits of trash, and the like. The village itself lies mostly to the west, its buildings broken, its peace shattered.

rooms.name: The Mermaid's Tail
rooms.description: The smells of tobacco smoke and cheap ale fill the dark air.  A large bronze fish, its tail missing, hangs behind the bar.  Apparently this is the favorite place for lesser officers of the orc army, for conversations have been known to proceed several minutes before a fight breaks out.  A stairwell leads up in the back.

rooms.name: Inn Reception
rooms.description: This is the reception area for Ogakh's inn, which luckily could be salvaged from the ruins of Tyllwedd.  Though it sits atop the noisy bar, it's better than a tent among the soldiers.  Several private rooms, small but dry, seem to be available.

rooms.name: Ruined House
rooms.description: A smoking ruin lies here.  This was apparently a small and tidy house before the orcs arrived.  Now it is a pile of ashes atop broken and scattered bricks. Nothing of value or use remains here.  Another ruin lies to the north, while a damaged but repaired structure rises two stories to the south.  A trash-strewn street runs by on the east.

rooms.name: Ruined Shop
rooms.description: Ashes and burnt boards lie in a mess.  Several large boards appear to have been shelves once, and a pile of scorched and muddy quills would seem to clinch the conclusion that this was once a shop of some kind.  Everything of value has been stolen or destroyed, including the building itself.  Another destroyed building lies to the south, and Market Square is east.

rooms.name: Arandidor's Dingy Companions
rooms.description: The owner of this shop must have some sense of humor, for the name is chalked above the door in wide white letters for all to see.  Strange, crablike specimens clatter in roofless wooden cages while foul-mouthed parrots curse all that pass nearby.  The smell is bad, unlike the open latrines of the nearby armies, but still bad.  An exit leads south.

rooms.name: Arandidor's Back Room
rooms.description: You should not be here! This room is for pets only.

extras.text: Burnt and broken planks are shoved into two piles to either side of the path. They look to have been carefully whitewashed and well-cared for for many years. Many varied pieces of pottery lie underfoot and in the piles of rubbish as well.  Closer inspection reveals that a variety of plants have sprouted, hinting that this may once have been a grocer's shop.

rooms.name: A Sulphurous Hulk
rooms.description: A small building once stood here by the side of the river, but it received the harsh treatment that orc hordes are wont to dispense.  Now, no two bricks stand atop one another.  The walls have been hacked into splinters.  Not all of the damage appears to have been inflicted by tools, however.  Some singed craters near the entrance appear to be the result of fiery explosions.

extras.text: They are pretty small, being only a couple of feet across, but the force of the explosions that created them must have been substantial.  There is even some bloodstaining on nearby bits of wood.  Whatever caused them failed to save the building, however.
The smoke seems to be pouring out of a hole hidden under a very large pile of rubble. It is yellowish-gray in color, and highly obnoxious in odor.

rooms.name: Trodden Path
rooms.description: A path runs north-south here through a cleared area.  The ruins of Tyllwedd are just to the south.  This is a scrubby area with only a few broken trees. The path continues north toward a large army encampment full of tents and small fires.  Far off to the north is a mountain range, shrouded in low clouds.

rooms.name: Trodden Path
rooms.description: An army encampment full of orcs is just north of here.  Their gruff bickering creates a dull roar that lies over the land like a cloud of discontent.  A well-used footpath leads south toward the ruins of the village of Tyllwedd.  A brisk river is some distance to the east, and mountains loom in the distant north.

rooms.name: Orc Encampment North
rooms.description: This is the southern edge of a wide army encampment.  The sounds of speech, growling, and bickering fill the air.  The smell of orcs is unmistakable, and the smoke of their fires lies everywhere.  A medium-sized tent sits off to the east, with guards around its entrance.

rooms.name: Entrance to a Gray Tent
rooms.description: The entrance to a large gray tent is just to the east.  The tent shows signs of many repairs, but is in good shape.  It bears no adornments and is not particularly well-lit.  However, there is steady traffic in and out.  An army encampment of orcs surrounds it to the north and west.

rooms.name: Tiny Street
rooms.description: This narrow street runs north-south between a wooden building to the west and a squat stone structure to the east.  There is an entrance to the stone building, and above it is a skilfully-painted yellowish-brown gem in a silvery setting.  The smell of horses drifts in from the west.

rooms.name: Tiny Street
rooms.description: A once-tidy street runs north-south through the ruined village of Tyllwedd. A fenced stableyard is off to the west, filling the air with equine aromas.  A dry dusty plot of earth sits to the east, sandwiched between strong stone buildings.  The street itself, once paved with irritating cobbles, is now a trench of mud and rubbish.  The interlocking arrangement of the cobbles can only be seen near its edges.

rooms.name: Tiny Street
rooms.description: A burned, scarred stone building sits just to the east.  It is scorched and pitted, and one wall shows massive cracks, but it still stands.  Its door is made of fresh thick oak and looks like a recent installment.  A large wooden structure to the west also shows signs of recent repair.  The street is muddy and rutted, and covered with trash.

rooms.name: A Shattered Gate
rooms.description: Stout oak logs are heaped to one side of the road, just outside the ruined village of Tyllwedd.  The village stands smoking to the north.  Most of the nearby buildings are intact, though showing signs of recent repair.  Drison Road leads south along the side of the river.  A huge tent stands to the west.

rooms.name: Drison Road
rooms.description: This muddy churned-up road runs along the side of Drison River to the east. The ruins of Tyllwedd are just past a heap of broken logs to the north, the remains of the village's south gate.  Far off to the west, the vast encampment of the orc army lies on the land like a blanket of locusts.

rooms.name: Intersection
rooms.description: Drison Road continues along the river here, turning east to follow it in its twisting bed.  A recent footpath leads west toward the orc army's noisome encampment.  Smoke drifts through the air, from cooking fires, forges, and the smouldering remains of Tyllwedd.

rooms.name: Jhanna's Jewelry
rooms.description: The thick walls of this building show no ill effects from the recent invasion.  Flashy bits of jewelry and tasteful yet depressing paintings adorn the wall, well behind the counter and away from grabby orc hands.  Two stairways lead upward: a larger one for customers of the bank above, and a smaller one in the opposite corner.

rooms.name: Ogakh Bank
rooms.description: The sign above the door was short and to the point, and this is clearly a financial institution.  No containers of any kind are visible.  However, a well-guarded door leads to a back room.  It appears to be a good and secure place for the deposit of excess gold.

rooms.name: Barren Garden
rooms.description: Smooth slate paving stones once encircled a small marble fountain in this tidy garden.  Now, they are torn up and broken, and mostly heaved into the river.  The fountain is gone but for its cracked base.  A heap of dried vegetation gives off a somewhat pleasant smell.  Perhaps they were flowers. Nothing but weeds grow here now.

rooms.name: Gaol
rooms.description: Iron fetters line the walls above crude wooden benches.  They are mostly in good repair, for even orcs know the value of incarceration.  The south wall is so heavily cracked as to allow in sunlight.  Unfortunately, the three foot thick walls would need to suffer far worse to permit escapes.  The front door, however, is made of fresh stout oak.

rooms.name: Barracks
rooms.description: This was once the barracks for Tyllwedd.  Some few soldiers must have made a stand here, for the brown and black bloodstains of the walls and floor are extensive.  It is a wonder the building still stands.  The street is visible to the east, and the sounds of combat practice can be heard to the west.

rooms.name: Warrior Guild
rooms.description: Orcs and ogres of exceptional intelligence and aptitude spar here in their efforts to become elite warriors and officers.  Scarred practice dummies line the walls, and a pile of broken weapons sits in the corner.  A few tapestries hang on the walls, but they have large portions torn out, or consist of only a scrap depicting a few dark shapes.  The exit is east.

rooms.name: Stable
rooms.description: This is the front room of a large stable whose yard extends some distance to the south.  Numerous multicolored mounts of odd species are visible.  Hay covers every square foot of floor, absorbing mud and masking the odor of equine urine.

rooms.name: Stableyard
rooms.description: You should not be here!

rooms.name: Farmer's Way Bridge
rooms.description: A sturdy wooden bridge crosses the Drison River here.  Its cold waters flow south toward the ocean.  The bridge leads west toward the center of Tyllwedd and east toward a few large buildings, one of which is broken and smoking. The bridge itself is wide, enough for a cart and a horseman to pass, though that would be dangerous now that its rails are broken off.  The bridge appears sound, however, having suffered no other visible damage.

rooms.name: Farmer's Way
rooms.description: This narrow road proceeds east away from Drison River toward a few large buildings and an intersection.  A short and new-looking building sits to the south, while another to the southeast is smouldering.  An even larger building far to the east appears to be in good repair.  The heavy foot traffic of Tyllwedd seems to have spared this road.

rooms.name: Farmer's Way
rooms.description: This cart-road curves here leading north and west.  Directly to the south is a large building, mostly broken and giving off clouds of smoke.  A side path continues east toward a larger mansion.  The road handles heavy traffic, but not so much that it is ground into a morass of muck or dust.

rooms.name: Driveway
rooms.description: A cart path makes a little loop here in front of a large mansion to the east.  The path leads west toward Farmer's Way and a ruined building to the southwest, while a side path goes south to a small temple.  The mansion is in good repair, though it does have a recently replaced front door, and several of its shutters are lying off to one side, the windows now boarded over.

rooms.name: Mayor's House
rooms.description: This is the humble home of the mayor of Tyllwedd.  It is at least three times as large as the other homes.  Its fine furniture is a bit scratched up but still attractive.  The artwork on the walls has suffered worse, being defaced and torn.  There appears to be a kitchen to the north and a bedroom to the east.

rooms.name: Kitchen
rooms.description: A cauldron hangs suspended over a warm hearth in the middle of the room. Rows of spices once stood neatly on shelves, but as any orc knows, food is food, and anything edible was quickly consumed.  Shuttered windows show a road far off to the north.  A there is an exit to the east, and the dining room is south.

rooms.name: Bedroom
rooms.description: The large bed in the middle of this room has the remains of fine linen sheets.  Most of the bedding has been torn or spoiled in some way, for even an orc general leaves much to be desired with his manners.  Large shuttered windows give a fine view of the countryside, for this building is on a small hill.

rooms.name: Despoiled Garden
rooms.description: This private garden may have been quite peaceful and beautiful at one time, but now it is merely private.  Only the stone benches survive unbroken.  Large quantities of dark-glassed bottles are piled against the southern wall, along with other garbage that assaults the nose.

rooms.name: Despoiled Pond
rooms.description: A careful ring of bricks surrounds an artificial pond in which nothing grows.  The water is murky and full of glass and trash.  Whatever lived in it is long dead and gone.  Ornamental shrubs and trees surround the pond, providing privacy.

rooms.name: A Fallen Courthouse
rooms.description: The roof of this building lies with the southern wall to the south.  Other walls still stand, blackened by fire and lightened by old whitewash.  All manner of broken furniture litters the floor here: chairs, desks, lamps, and the like.  There is a doorway into the courtroom to the south, and a road runs by on the north.

rooms.name: A Fallen Courtroom
rooms.description: Some benches are lying in a jumbled broken mess in the corner.  Their destruction appears to be incidental, but the judge's pulpit suffered no random attack.  It is nowhere to be seen, unless it has become the pile of chopped wood that now rots in the south of the room.  The roof overhead looks unsteady. An open doorway leads north.

rooms.name: Westroad
rooms.description: A hard-used road leads west out of the heart of the ruined village.  A battered but patched wooden building rises two stories high to the north.  The broken bronze sculpture over its lintel marks it as the Mermaid's Tail, and a raucous din emanates from its wide open door.  The smell of horses drifts in from the south, where a sturdy building sits in front of a stableyard.

extras.text: The tail is rather large, but its wide fan-shape marks it as the tail of a fish, not a mermaid.  Local rumors tell that the inn once had an entire bronze fish, but it was broken during the invasion.  The enterprising new inkeeper made the best of the situation, knowing that orc soldiers are connoissers of neither fish nor mermaids.

rooms.name: Path Through a Ruin
rooms.description: A wide footpath runs north-south here through a burnt-out ruin.  Market Square of the late village of Tyllwedd is to the south, and an army encampment is some distance north.  The building through which the path runs has been wrecked and burned, and its rubble rudly pushed aside to make way for the soldiers and messengers who now pass through.

rooms.name: Westroad
rooms.description: The remains of Tyllwedd are just east of here.  An inn and a stable are the first buildings.  Past the inn, to the northeast, smoking ruins of the former village send plumes into the air.  The road also leads west between the orc armies, and there is a clearing to the south.

rooms.name: Drison Road
rooms.description: The road swerves about as it follows some ancient track.  A smoking village looms off to the north, and the waters of Drison River flow by a little to the east.  The smell of a nearby Ogre encampment is unmistakable.  It mingles with the scent of orcs and smoke that drifts in from the west.  A few guards seem to have set up a post just a little further down the road toward the river.

rooms.name: Southern Guard Post
rooms.description: A standard rises from the ground, proclaiming to all who would enter that this is the city of Ogakh.  A trashy clearing next to the road looks like a mini-encampment, no doubt the traces of the motly orcs who drew the bad luck to guard this post.  Drison Road passes through on its way to the remains of Tyllwedd to the north, and the long journey south to the Drison's mouth begins here.

rooms.name: Outskirts
rooms.description: Drison Road crosses the outer edges of Ogakh here.  A guard post sits next to the road just north of here, no doubt a show of force for any who would dare to approach the orc encampment uninvited.  The smell of the nearby army, visible to the west, drifts over the land like a noxious blanket.  The road also leads south.  To the east stands a rickety shack of some kind.

rooms.name: Watering Hole
rooms.description: Horses and other mounts can be heard nickering in the stable to the east. Whether the water here is shared by them or is expressly for the parade of orcs that drink it is uncertain, but the stable owner must be compensated for all the water he is providing.  Westroad runs by to the north, and the clearing extends south a ways.

rooms.name: Meeting Area
rooms.description: A solitary ironwood tree stands in the middle of the clearing.  Somehow, it thrives in the chaos that has enveloped the village.  Numerous notes hang from it, nailed, stapled, and punched over short twigs.  A stableyard full of large beasts of burden is off to the east behind a strong fence.

rooms.name: Westroad
rooms.description: The road bears the scars of heavy usage here, running east and west.  The smoking ruin of Tyllwedd lies on the banks of the Drison some distance to the east.  The vast army of orcs stretches out to the southwest, its cooking fires filling the air with smoke.  Another army lies far in the distance to the northeast.

rooms.name: Westroad
rooms.description: A massive encampment of orcs, mostly to the southwest, comes to an end here. A ruined village smokes far to the east.  The air is full of the sounds of arguments and fighting, and a variety of unpleasant smells.  The road is wide and muddy.  A thick forest of conifers lies off to the north beyond a field of stumps.

rooms.name: Westroad
rooms.description: The orc encampment to the south may be entered here by one of its many footpaths.  Like every other road in the area, the path is soggy and wet, and strewn with trash.  Westroad itself curves a bit to the north.  It also leads east toward the village of Tyllwedd, whose ruins smoke in the distance.

rooms.name: Westroad
rooms.description: The road curves west and south here as it follows its ancient route to the port city of Solta.  A wide encampment sits adjacent to the road on the south, full of orc soldiers and their camp followers.  A forest to the north once abutted the road, but it is rapidly feeding the cooking fires.  A few large, well-kept tents are next to the road just west of here.

rooms.name: Merchants Row
rooms.description: Some tolerant and hard-working merchants have set up shop directly across from the orc army.  The presence of particularly large and well-mannered -- but still very mean-spirited -- soldiers is impossible to miss.  The tent to the north has a drawing of a hand with a shining gem in its palm.

rooms.name: Merchants Row
rooms.description: Westroad's conversion into a city street is an uneasy one, and the merchant's tent to the north, while in good repair, looks as though it could be removed overnight.  It has a small shingle hanging from it with a hammer and a sack.  The ground underfoot is a muddy mess, but thankfully free of larger debris.

rooms.name: Merchants Row
rooms.description: Westroad meets a path here that leads south into the heart of the orc army's encampment.  Directly to the north, an enterprising leather merchant has set up a large tent and is attempting to eke out a living among the argumentative orcs.  More merchants are directly to the east.  The smell of cooking wafts in from the south.

rooms.name: Westroad
rooms.description: The road continues on its meandering course.  The encampment to the south still sits directly up against the road and its noise is distracting.  A large tent sits to the northeast; it could be entered by going east.  The road is muddy and ill-used, and the smells of the orcs permeate the air.

rooms.name: Westroad
rooms.description: A trio of large, well-lit tents sit directly to the east, but their entrances are not visible from here.  The road appears to be twisting and turning on its own course.  The orc army stretches far off to the south.  It appears vast, especially from this perspective.  A forest to the north is suffering from the orcs' presence, for a wide band of stumps now borders the road.

rooms.name: Orc Encampment South
rooms.description: The tents of the orc army surround the area, but Westroad lies directly north.  The smell of cooking food drifts in from the mess area to the south. The ground is trashy and muddy, and it is difficult to move quickly.  Strange smells assault the senses.

rooms.name: Mess Area
rooms.description: Several large makeshift stone ovens belch noxious smoke into the sky and down toward the ground, which no doubt accounts for the "unique" flavor of the food produced here.  Mighty cauldrons bubble atop steaming fires.  The tents of the army give this place a wide berth, probably after tiring of the fires caused by flying embers.

rooms.name: Woddly's Wargoods
rooms.description: Anywhere else, this might be called a general store, for it sells basic items needed by travelers everwhere.  But Woddly is a born salesman, and knows that soldiers don't take kindly to shiftless adventuring, and don't practice general pursuits, oh no -- they're into war and destruction, and need the tools to execute that serious task.

rooms.name: A Quick Spell
rooms.description: This is a spacious tent, but most of the area is off-limits to patrons. Behind a wide but temporary wooden counter hang numerous scrolls.  Pots of potions sit around the edge, and a few odd-colored birds perch up near the roof.  No doubt the rogues and wizards of the army find this place useful.

rooms.name: Leather Goods
rooms.description: Sleeves, leggings, caps, and tunics lie about in stacks.  The leather quality looks good enough, if the manufacture is a bit lazy.  The smell of tannin drifts through the air.  It is not strong, for the market for new armor is not brisk.  An exit leads south out of the tent.

rooms.name: Rogue Central
rooms.description: Odd lighting casts an uneven glow in this quiet tent.  Curious figures lurk in the shadows, practicing lethal encounters with unsuspecting dummies.  Some dummies have bells, while others have strange pockets.  The center of the test, however, is well-lit if you have business to conduct.

rooms.name: Farmer's Way
rooms.description: This short lane passes north of a stout stone building and leads east, away from town center toward a bridge.  The wooden bridge is just large enough for a horse-drawn cart.  The smoking ruins of Tyllwedd lie off to the north.  The road is muddy and strewn with debris.

rooms.name: Orc Encampment South
rooms.description: A small path leads south into heart of the orc army's south encampment. Among the tents of the soldiers are a few larger tents, one of which sits directly to the west.  A signpost has been planted in the earth next to the entrance.  The path continues south toward a few larger tents and a mysterious black one, and north back to Westroad.

extras.text: Upon the signpost is a slab of wood with a charred inscription. An image lies below, depicting a nest of serpents. The inscription reads: Mokh-ob Krimpphosh-hudh

rooms.name: Entrance to the Twining Serpents
rooms.description: This appears to be a waiting room of some sort, where injured soldiers bide their time until the clerics beyond deign to see to their wounds.  Bloodstains dot the floor, the furniture, and the very walls of this tent.  An exit leads east, while the inner sanctum is west.

rooms.name: Sanctum of the Twining Serpents
rooms.description: Low flickering torches light the room.  They chatter and grumble even in the absence of any breeze.  A small portable altar is tied to the rear of the tent. Even with the torches, it is rather dark.  The altar can barely be seen. Unlike the waiting room outside, it is clean here, right down to the fresh burlap mat waiting for the next patient's drops of blood, if any should fall.

rooms.name: Battle Street
rooms.description: This is no street, but signs blaringly proclaim otherwise: this is clearly known as "Battle Street".  It seems to be a merchant's ploy, for a shop festooned with weapons lies directly to the east.  To the west is a large, black tent, with a small covered corridor as an entryway.

rooms.name: Entrance to the Black Tent
rooms.description: The reason for this highly controlled entryway is not immediately clear. It leads west into a spacious black tent with low lighting, or back east to a path in the orc encampment.  As if the guttering sconces were not enough, someone has painted a ball of white fire on each side of the passage.

rooms.name: Black Sorcery
rooms.description: Freestanding sconces light the interior of this black tent well enough. Several of them stand in a circle well away from the opaque fabric walls, leaving a lighted central area with desks, shelves, and tables.  Chests are piled high in the rear; some appear not to have been opened in some time.  The smell of odd chemicals drifts about.

rooms.name: Ralg's Weapons
rooms.description: The ground here is dry but the straw is ground into powdery bits by the constant stream of customers both buying and selling.  Weapons of every conceivable type and quality (except good) festoon every wall.  Barrels of rusty swords and chests of twisted daggers line the walls.  A few choice items are mounted just behind the proprietor, out of the reach of grabby orc paws.

rooms.name: Battle Street
rooms.description: This little footpath meanders among the tents of soldiers in the orc army's southern encampment.  A buckler is crudely stapled over the entrance to a medium-sized tent to the east; other shops appear to be north and south of it. A very large black tent looms to the northwest.

rooms.name: Unndush's Shields
rooms.description: The tall canvas walls of this tent rise almost vertically to the sloped roof.  A system of wooden frames is propped up on the north and south walls, and on them are hung many kinds of shields.  Bucklers, tower shields, armguards, and spiked shields are carefully arranged by size and weight. Piles of broken and incomplete shields lie behind a cordon.

rooms.name: Battle Street Intersection
rooms.description: The street, such as it is, runs north-south here through the orc encampment. Another of the many paths leads west past some very large tents to the south. One large tent sits directly to the east, and its entrance is festooned with bronze decorations.

rooms.name: Krigg's Bronzeware
rooms.description: The proprietor of this shop must love bronze greatly - it covers every available surface.  Medallions, chains, mirrors, and even weapons and armor are hung, nailed, or tied everywhere.  Tarnished baubles inhabit even the dustiest corners of this little tent.  Naturally, most of it is for sale.

rooms.name: Downforge Iron
rooms.description: Here is a path that actually bears some resemblance to a street.  Instead of straw, stones litter the ground, and instead of canvas tent walls, boards face the walkway (though often singed and burned).  The reason appears to be the massive forge off to the southwest, which belches forth smoke, steam, and sparks.  The sound of clanking also comes from a small tent-building to the south.

rooms.name: Downforge Forge
rooms.description: The sound of hammering is loud and annoying.  It comes from the large forge to the south, where clanking and whooshing sounds emanate along with smoke and steam.  Passers-by do not linger at this spot, for it is difficult to speak, or indeed to avoid being set afire by the occasional shower of sparks.

rooms.name: Downforge Steel
rooms.description: An intersection is formed here by an east-west path and another going north. Unlike the other paths in this encampment, wooden walls face it, apparently to defend against the embers and smoke coming from a loud, clanking forge to the southeast.  A small building sits to the south, with the unmistakable merchant's shingle advertising armor and weapons in gleaming steel.

rooms.name: Orc Encampment South
rooms.description: Tents cluster about, with perhaps three or four sharing a stone-line firepit.  A path can be discerned running north south between them.  The smell of smoke and quenched iron drifts in from the south along with clanking and yelling noises.  The encampment gives the impression of having been here for some time, what with the piles of garbage everywhere.

rooms.name: Orc Encampment South
rooms.description: A little path runs north-south through the tents.  One particularly large tent lies to the east, with a high central point and made of the blackest canvas, but there is no entrance here.  A mildly appetizing odor drifts in from the north, appetizing to the very hungry that is.  A large tent to the west appears to have many loud, singing orcs in it.

rooms.name: Grulo's Ironguard
rooms.description: Swords, shields, breastplates and more are on display for sale. Understandably, few of them are hung on the walls of this half-tent, half-building.  Some of Grulo's goods give the appearance of heavy use, though rust is difficult to find.  Dust and cobwebs are beginning to form on some displays.  Still, iron is trustworthy and the shop looks successful.

rooms.name: Army Forge
rooms.description: A blaring clatter assaults the ears, along with the roaring of bellows that feed intensely hot fires.  Smoke hangs in the heated air, singeing the lungs. Steam rises as glowing iron is quenched.  Sparks fly about to burn the shoes of the flat-footed.  Two massive hearths issue an endless deep-throated growl as unyielding metal is softened in their embrace, to be pounded mercilessly on the nearby anvils.

rooms.name: Ghiala's Steelworks
rooms.description: This perfectly-organized shop displays gleaming steel items with regimented precision.  Daggers, swords, greaves and breastplates are organized into exact designs that speak of perfection and power.  No trace of dust or cobweb is to be seen anywhere, and there is even a flap over the door to the dirty forge next door.

rooms.name: Post Office
rooms.description: The smell of fresh mortar wafts off the stone-and-brick walls of this squat building.  The floor looks older, with cracked and scorched stones.  Still, it appears to be serviceable for the sending and receiving of mail.  A counter separates the rear of the building, to the south, from the customers.

rooms.name: Biergarten
rooms.description: This tent is wide but not very high, and there isn't much light to see by. The only exit appears to be through a flap to the east.  Many stumps, stones, and even a few chairs are set up to allow patrons - for this is a bar of some kind - to sit and drink.  The smell of the latrine is a bit annoying.

rooms.name: Orc Encampment South
rooms.description: This is a trail in the orc army encampment, or at least it was.  The trail peters out to the west among a cluster of randomly-placed tents.  Some large tents lie off to the southeast, belching smoke.  The path leads east among the soldiers and their fires.

rooms.name: Battle Street
rooms.description: The street passes north-south, leaving the army encampment to the north. Some large tents rise to the west.  Smoke drifts from one of them.  The smells and sounds of the encampment assault the senses.  There is little relief to the south, however, for an ogre encampment is visible a short distance off.

rooms.name: Battle Street Intersection
rooms.description: This little road runs through what apparently was a planted field not long ago.  All of the crops have been plundered, chopped, burned, and crushed by the army, however.  Battle Street runs north-south, while a side path continues to the east.  There is evidence of wheeled vehicles passing through the area.

rooms.name: Path in a Ruined Field
rooms.description: Ruined crops surround this east-west path.  A rowdy encampment of orcs is off to the northwest, and a similarly loud though smaller encampment of ogres is to the southwest.  This path leads east through a field.  The field's rows have been crushed by countless feet, and its crops ripped out and left to rot. There seems to be a hill to the southeast.

rooms.name: Path in a Ruined Field
rooms.description: The ruined village of Tyllwedd is visible far off to the northeast.  Smoke rises high in the air.  Surrounding this east-west path is farmland, or what is left of it after the ravages of an army.  A strong odor rises from a small hill of refuse to the southeast.

rooms.name: Path by a Dump
rooms.description: This is a small east-west path through some farmland.  Directly to the south is a rather large pile of refuse.  Its contents are difficult to identify from here, but the smell seems, thankfully, to indicate that bodies do not make up the bulk of it.  The village of Tyllwedd is some distance to the northeast, and a large encampment of some kind is off to the west.

rooms.name: Path in a Ruined Field
rooms.description: This is an east-west path that passes directly through some kind of crop. Whatever it was is difficult to determine, as it has been systematically looted or destroyed.  The path meets a road just to the east which might be used to reach the village of Tyllwedd, some distance to the north.  A heap of refuse sits stinking to the southwest.

rooms.name: The Dumping Ground
rooms.description: This looks to be the dumping spot for the nearby orc army.  All manner of rotting food, unusuble leather, and other rubbish is heaped about in a kind of semicircle.  The cries of scavenger birds echo through the air.  A bit of smoke is visible far to the north, probably rising from the village of Tyllwedd.

rooms.name: A Refuse Heap
rooms.description: Garbage is heaped up here in a small hill.  The stink is tremendous - almost enough to fell a sturdy ox should it be caught unprepared.  Footing is treacherous, and sharp objects are mixed in with the trash.  The hill appears lower to the north, and beyond that is a path.

rooms.name: Orc Encampment North
rooms.description: Small fires surrounded by tents dot the landscape.  A little path passes through them here, crossing the ploughed fields of what was once a farmland. The murmuring of the orcs fills the air, a bit more subdued than one would normally expect.  Things seem a bit more organized here than in the southern encampment.

rooms.name: Orc Encampment North
rooms.description: The path is coming to an end to the north.  It leads south through the tents of the orc army toward the smoking ruin of Tyllwedd.  Bits of trash litter the ground, though it is far from out of control.  The dead stalks of a grain crop, apparently rye, lie flattened under the relentless footsteps of the occupying army.

rooms.name: Orc Encampment North
rooms.description: A path leads south from here, and two lighter footpaths lead east and west. The tents of a reposing army lie thick on this field, long since stripped of its crop.  The western path leads to a pair of tents, one a deep red and the other a dark blue.  The eastern path leads to long, low building some distance away.

rooms.name: A Private Yard
rooms.description: The ground here, between the red and blue tents, is very clean and does not seem to see much traffic.  A deep red tent sits to the north, its entrance open but guarded.  A similar dark blue tent is directly to the west.  Army tents surround the area, but at a respectful distance.  A footpath leads east.

rooms.name: Incanta Infernus
rooms.description: The inside of this tent is quite warm...  The several fires on the ground and the multitude of lit candles might have something to do with that. Strangely, there is no smoke whatsoever.  Portable shelves hold a collection of large leather tomes, scrolls, and reagents.  The exit is south.

rooms.name: The Cryomancer's Tent
rooms.description: This is obvously the tent of a mighty sorcerer, for the tingling touch of magic forces all the hairs on your body to stand up in unison.  The chill of the air might have something to do with it as well.  A collection of leather-bound and fur-covered books sits on some frail-looking shelves, along with a great number of thick glass vials, most of which appear to contain solid substances.  The open flap of the tent's exit lies to the east.

rooms.name: In Among the Tents
rooms.description: This looked like a footpath at first, but now it seems to simply be a slightly open area among the many tents of this encampment.  A long building is visible off to the east, and a pair of red and blue tents are some distance to the west.  Dried, ruined crops crunch underfoot, the last remains of a farmer's toil.

rooms.name: Before a Black Stone Temple
rooms.description: A long building made of black stone lies directly to the east.  It is low to the ground and has a flat wooden roof.  The mortar between the stones seems not to have set completely.  The building stretches north and south a ways, but the sole visible entrance is here.  Army tents cluster around it.  It is possible to make one's way between the tents to the west.

rooms.name: Temple of the Dark Gods
rooms.description: This is a low building of black stone, seemingly constructed recently for the worship of dark gods.  Smouldering sconces sit high in the corners.  Their flickering light barely illuminates the room, where worshipers come to wait for their high priests.  The exit is west.

rooms.name: Lair of Destruction
rooms.description: The smell of blood permeates the air.  This is a large room, and its walls are decorated with cruel implements - not only of torture, but also of raw battlefield destruction, of killing with cruelty.  A few large skulls are among the decorations, but their species is unfamiliar.

rooms.name: Pit of Madness
rooms.description: Few recognizable symbols or objects are to be found here.  The consummation of the blending of healing and destruction has left its insane product in this room, and woe to those who enter unprepared.  An altar like a bath of blood sits in the center of the room, its surface uncalm.

rooms.name: The Temple Path
rooms.description: A gentle footpath leads south to a temple.  There is a road just off to the north, leading to a mansion to the northeast.  Another road goes north into the distance.  The land is slightly hilly here, and the temple, now only a short walk southeast, sits up on rise.

rooms.name: The Temple Yard
rooms.description: This small circular yard sits just in front of a little temple to the east. Low, green grass grows all around, and a footpath leads north.  A long ruined structure sits to the west.  There seems to be a walled area south of the temple, but it is elevated, and somewhat behind the building.  Steps lead up to the temple's entrance, to the east.

East.description: A door leads into the temple.

rooms.name: Tyllwedd Temple
rooms.description: Although the walls of this temple are largely intact, it has not escaped a certain destruction.  All of the furniture is missing.  The walls are covered in blasphemous graffiti that speaks of the worst kind of madness and destruction.  The floor is spattered with blood and gouged horribly.  Doors lead south and west, and a staircase leads up.

South.description: A cast-iron gate leads into a small graveyard.

West.description: A door leads out of the temple

rooms.name: Home of the Deathcheater
rooms.description: If a priest once lived here, he would cringe to see it now.  The entire room has been painted an extremely dark purple color, and its sturdy furniture is covered in orcish writing.  Flickering lanterns provide a sickly light.  A staircase leads down to the ground floor.

rooms.name: A Cemetery
rooms.description: This is a small cemetery, suitable for the needs of a little farming village on a gentle river.  Or at least it was, prior to the arrival of a bloodthirsty army.  Now, the systematic knocking over of the headstones is the least of this place's faults: the stinking and decaying heaps of corpses are rather worse. Why they have been placed here is not immediately clear.

North.description: A cast-iron gate leads north, into a small temple.

rooms.name: Farmer's Cartway
rooms.description: A narrow road runs alongside the Drison here, which is flowing by on the west.  The road goes north into the fields.  A few buildings of Tyllwedd are off to the south, though the bulk of the village is across the river, lying in smoking ruins.  A mansion rises to the southeast.

rooms.name: Northern Guard Post
rooms.description: A clearing interrupts a narrow north-south road here.  A pole has been set in the ground to one side with the standard of the orc army hanging from it. Bits of trash litter the ground, no doubt dropped carelessly by the small contingent of soldiers assigned to watch this little-traveled path.  Tyllwedd, or its ruins, are visible across the Drison river to the west.

rooms.name: Farmer's Cartway
rooms.description: The Drison River runs northeast, and this road curves along to follow it. The ruins of Tyllwedd can be seen on the opposite side, some distance to the west.  There seems to be a guard post to the south with some sort of standard. Mountains rise to the east, while the cartway leads into a wide farmed valley to the north.

rooms.name: Western Guard Post
rooms.description: A post has been set up here to intercept whatever travelers may think to approach the orc army.  The standard flies high on a post, proclaiming to all that the village of Tyllwedd no longer exists, and that orcs now claim this land. The desultory pacing of the guards has worn a clearing in the grass.

rooms.name: Westroad
rooms.description: The road goes generally northwest and southeast through a former forest. Fresh stumps dot the landscape.  A city of tents, possibly the encampment of an army, is spread out on flatter land to the southeast.  Smoke rises from large fires far to the east.  A guard post of some kind interrupts the road directly to the east.

rooms.name: Spiral Entry
rooms.description: The circular interior of this building is painted a rust-red color.  A spiral staircase rises up in the middle.  All around it, odd symbols are written.  They appear to be in some sort of sequence, but they are not orcish. A wide doorway leads east.

rooms.name: The Entrance to the Berserker Guild
rooms.description: You stand before a massive tent just outside the shattered gate to Tyllwedd. The sack of Tyllwedd by monstrous forces are depicted on the outside of the tent in a brutally celebratory style.

rooms.name: The Berserker Guild
rooms.description: The members of the Berserker Guild are headquartered just outside the sacked town of Tyllwedd.  Deemed too frenzied and reckless even for the residents of Ogakh, the berserker squads are kept just beyond the more settled parts of the outpost to minimize the risk their presence poses.

rooms.name: Castaway Cartography
rooms.description: It is not clear what the room was before the outcast made it his shop but clearly it wasn't a room that held anything with value.  The slatted roof doesn't do much to shelter the shop - this is clear from the slew of water damaged maps leaning against the wall behind the desk.
